title: Crazy Chili Dog
key_quotes: ["half of these entries don't make any sense to the reader [or the writer
haha]"
"Sometimes the door without a sign is the sign"
"My oh my
how the times have changed. A full tank. No Angel. Triple digits. Reconciliation."]
summary: Dense esoteric 2007 reflection. References 'Team Paul' (Bobbo + Jimmy) and their 'March Down Washington' compared to Road to XXIV. Mentions reconciliation (likely with family). 'The lone warrior, a god, you have become.' Directs readers to Diana DiBuccio's page. Comments include Jim Butler posting from Costco with satirical political commentary and an anonymous commenter calling John's articles 'controversial.'

title: Yeah, I Said It
key_quotes: ["I cannot and will not pass any negative sanction upon anything I've ever said because I know at one time
at that specific time
it's how I felt"
"The power of an internal desire liberated!"
"regret ever regretting"
"Inner joy. Endless privilege and pleasure. I've never felt happier to be alive than here and now"]
summary: Major 2008 reflection with raw honesty. Reveals: 2005 near-anorexia ('borderline-anorexic and mental car crash'), 2004 car accident caused panic attacks and anxiety (now resolved). Six-year Letsche friendship rocky patch resolved at Rumble '08. Confronted Aimee when nobody else would. Robert Phillips wedding approaching. Kitty Nogueira is the younger sister of a former partner. Massive thank-you list with 30+ creative nicknames. 'Victoria Grace Tronolone?' suggests baby name speculation. This is where 'The power of an internal desire liberated!' first appears — March 2008, pre-coming-out. 8 comments including Kevin Megill praising writing style and an anonymous commenter writing a 200-word essay on honesty vs. self-censorship.

title: Nut Cracker
key_quotes: ["the fraudulent smile was dissipating"
"someone crushed his acorn"]
summary: Dense allegorical post around 24th birthday. Metaphor of a squirrel whose acorn was crushed. References 'open heart surgery' as emotional vulnerability. Mentions Facebook/face deactivation and 'E122' (room number?). Jim Butler called it 'way too esoteric.' Pam D responded: 'When Jim Butler calls you esoteric, well...that's just hilarious (pot, meet kettle).'

title: Click Click Boom
key_quotes: ["Life is Beautiful - Jim Butler"
"half of these entries do not make any sense to the reader [or the writer
haha]"]
summary: Summer 2008 reflection. Character profiles of closest friends. Sections: The Ramble (number memorization), Air Purification I & II (WM ticket dispute resolution), Day of Selfishness (Sep 27 birthday), All The Pretty Faces (new friends), Support Staff (6 people thanked). Concludes with chip bag / stale chips metaphor about needing 'new flavors' in life.

title: On Newsstands Now
key_quotes: ["Sometimes it is hell trying to get to heaven - The Undertaker Jan 2009"
"The power of an internal desire liberated! - J. Tronolone March 2008"
"I got tired of kissin ass"]
summary: Written as newspaper articles. 171 weekly ECD events, 500+ participants. Names 30+ people in support staff section. WM25 preview with Valerie, Letsche, Travis Mills. Newspaper headline style: 'THREE-YEAR VETERAN TRONOLONE HANGS UP DODGEBALL BOOTS.'

title: Ring Ring!
key_quotes: ["It was not something I was happy about doing
but it is something I am happy I did"
"I have walked this plank before and I am not afraid to jump off again"]
summary: Post-ECD retirement manifesto structured as days of the week. Saturday = new freedom after dodgeball. Sunday = cooking/sifting metaphor for choosing real friends. Tuesday = processing the 2008 coming-out revelation. 'The pessimism surrounding the now-lifelong journey has vanished.' References WM25 Houston trip plans.

title: Kia Sorento
key_quotes: ["The power of an internal desire liberated!"
"I finally came to the realization that I needed to move away from something that simply did not make me happy anymore"]
summary: Extended car-journey metaphor covering 2005-2010. First Blood = 2005 family estrangement and recovery. Candlelight Dinner = 723-day relationship ending Nov 2006, liberation in 2008. Farmer's Market = ECD golden age and retirement. Hawk Airport = Monmouth University turbulence and graduation triumph. Named after a Kia Sorento commercial.

title: The Influlist
key_quotes: ["the beginning not of a temporary diet
but a desperate lifestyle alteration"
"He simply made being a wrestling fan acceptable
the in thing"
"popped in a dusty VHS and the miniature television screen lit up... Ric Flair narrowly winning the 92 Royal Rumble"]
summary: Profiles of 5 most influential people. James Butler: gym training partner who catalyzed fitness transformation. Phil Campanella: wrestling buddy from Monmouth Regional HS hall outside room 306, made WWE fandom cool. Mrs. Amorino: after-school caretaker who introduced wrestling via dusty VHS tapes. Grant Cornero & Chris Arbach: fitness body inspiration.

title: Merrie Melodies (Part I)
key_quotes: ["I said exactly what I needed to say; now I look back with a smile"
"I came out in 2008"]
summary: 6 songs matched to 6 people. La Bouche → Stopa (dodgeball dance), Mariah → Jake Mauro (computer replay obsession), Britney → Corcione (karaoke king), Jimmy Eat World → Valerie (Falcon Years graduation), Everlast → Edwards (MySpace profile song), John Mayer → KMJ (coming-out dinner moment).
